verses.kjv: Now I say, That the heir, as long as he is a child, differeth nothing from a servant, though he be lord of all;
verses.web: But I say that so long as the heir is a child, he is no different from a bondservant, though he is lord of all,
verses.ct: Here's what I mean: as long as an heir is still a child, he's no different from a slave — even though he technically owns everything.

verses.kjv: But is under tutors and governors until the time appointed of the father.
verses.web: but is under guardians and stewards until the day appointed by the father.
verses.ct: He's under the control of guardians and managers until the date his father has set.

verses.kjv: Even so we, when we were children, were in bondage under the elements of the world:
verses.web: So we also, when we were children, were held in bondage under the elemental principles of the world.
verses.ct: It was the same with us. When we were spiritually immature, we were enslaved to the basic principles of this world.

verses.kjv: But when the fulness of the time was come, God sent forth his Son, made of a woman, made under the law,
verses.web: But when the fullness of the time came, God sent out his Son, born to a woman, born under the law,
verses.ct: But when the right time had fully come, God sent his Son, born of a woman, born under the law,

verses.kjv: To redeem them that were under the law, that we might receive the adoption of sons.
verses.web: that he might redeem those who were under the law, that we might receive the adoption of children.
verses.ct: to set free everyone who was under the law, so that we could be adopted as God's own children.

verses.kjv: And because ye are sons, God hath sent forth the Spirit of his Son into your hearts, crying, Abba, Father.
verses.web: And because you are children, God sent out the Spirit of his Son into your hearts, crying, “Abba, Father!”
verses.ct: And because you are his children, God sent the Spirit of his Son into your hearts, crying out, "Abba, Father!"

verses.kjv: Wherefore thou art no more a servant, but a son; and if a son, then an heir of God through Christ.
verses.web: So you are no longer a bondservant, but a son; and if a son, then an heir of God through Christ.
verses.ct: So you are no longer a slave but a son or daughter. And if you are God's child, then you are also an heir through Christ.

verses.kjv: Howbeit then, when ye knew not God, ye did service unto them which by nature are no gods.
verses.web: However at that time, not knowing God, you were in bondage to those who by nature are not gods.
verses.ct: Before, when you didn't know God, you served things that aren't really gods at all.

verses.kjv: But now, after that ye have known God, or rather are known of God, how turn ye again to the weak and beggarly elements, whereunto ye desire again to be in bondage?
verses.web: But now that you have come to know God, or rather to be known by God, why do you turn back again to the weak and miserable elemental principles, to which you desire to be in bondage all over again?
verses.ct: But now that you know God — or rather, now that God knows you — how can you turn back to those weak and worthless principles? Do you really want to be enslaved by them all over again?

verses.kjv: Ye observe days, and months, and times, and years.
verses.web: You observe days, months, seasons, and years.
verses.ct: You're observing special days, months, seasons, and years.

verses.kjv: I am afraid of you, lest I have bestowed upon you labour in vain.
verses.web: I am afraid for you, that I might have wasted my labor for you.
verses.ct: I'm afraid for you. I'm worried that all my hard work among you was for nothing.

verses.kjv: Brethren, I beseech you, be as I am; for I am as ye are: ye have not injured me at all.
verses.web: I beg you, brothers, become as I am, for I also have become as you are. You did me no wrong,
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, I'm begging you — become like me, because I became like you. You never did me any wrong.

verses.kjv: Ye know how through infirmity of the flesh I preached the gospel unto you at the first.
verses.web: but you know that because of weakness in the flesh I preached the Good News to you the first time.
verses.ct: You know it was because of a physical illness that I first preached the gospel to you.

verses.kjv: And my temptation which was in my flesh ye despised not, nor rejected; but received me as an angel of God, even as Christ Jesus.
verses.web: That which was a temptation to you in my flesh, you didn’t despise nor reject; but you received me as an angel of God, even as Christ Jesus.
verses.ct: Even though my condition was a trial for you, you didn't look down on me or turn me away. Instead, you welcomed me as if I were an angel of God — as if I were Christ Jesus himself.

verses.kjv: Where is then the blessedness ye spake of? for I bear you record, that, if it had been possible, ye would have plucked out your own eyes, and have given them to me.
verses.web: What was the blessing you enjoyed? For I testify to you that, if possible, you would have plucked out your eyes and given them to me.
verses.ct: What happened to that joy you had? I can honestly say that back then, you would have torn out your own eyes and given them to me if you could have.

verses.kjv: Am I therefore become your enemy, because I tell you the truth?
verses.web: So then, have I become your enemy by telling you the truth?
verses.ct: So have I become your enemy just because I tell you the truth?

verses.kjv: They zealously affect you, but not well; yea, they would exclude you, that ye might affect them.
verses.web: They zealously seek you in no good way. No, they desire to alienate you, that you may seek them.
verses.ct: Those people are working hard to win you over, but not for your good. They want to cut you off from us so that you'll become devoted to them instead.

verses.kjv: But it is good to be zealously affected always in a good thing, and not only when I am present with you.
verses.web: But it is always good to be zealous in a good cause, and not only when I am present with you.
verses.ct: It's always a good thing to be passionate about something worthwhile — not just when I'm there with you.

verses.kjv: My little children, of whom I travail in birth again until Christ be formed in you,
verses.web: My little children, of whom I am again in travail until Christ is formed in you—
verses.ct: My dear children, I feel like I'm going through the pain of childbirth with you all over again, and it won't stop until Christ is fully formed in you.

verses.kjv: I desire to be present with you now, and to change my voice; for I stand in doubt of you.
verses.web: but I could wish to be present with you now, and to change my tone, for I am perplexed about you.
verses.ct: I wish I could be there with you right now and change my tone, because honestly, I don't know what to make of you.

verses.kjv: Tell me, ye that desire to be under the law, do ye not hear the law?
verses.web: Tell me, you that desire to be under the law, don’t you listen to the law?
verses.ct: Tell me something — you who want to live under the law, have you actually listened to what the law says?

verses.kjv: For it is written, that Abraham had two sons, the one by a bondmaid, the other by a freewoman.
verses.web: For it is written that Abraham had two sons, one by the servant, and one by the free woman.
verses.ct: Scripture says that Abraham had 2 sons: one by a slave woman and one by a free woman.

verses.kjv: But he who was of the bondwoman was born after the flesh; but he of the freewoman was by promise.
verses.web: However, the son by the servant was born according to the flesh, but the son by the free woman was born through promise.
verses.ct: The slave woman's son was born through ordinary human means, but the free woman's son was born because of God's promise.

verses.kjv: Which things are an allegory: for these are the two covenants; the one from the mount Sinai, which gendereth to bondage, which is Agar.
verses.web: These things contain an allegory, for these are two covenants. One is from Mount Sinai, bearing children to bondage, which is Hagar.
verses.ct: This story has a deeper meaning. The 2 women represent 2 covenants. One covenant comes from Mount Sinai and produces slaves — that's Hagar.

verses.kjv: For this Agar is mount Sinai in Arabia, and answereth to Jerusalem which now is, and is in bondage with her children.
verses.web: For this Hagar is Mount Sinai in Arabia, and answers to the Jerusalem that exists now, for she is in bondage with her children.
verses.ct: Hagar stands for Mount Sinai in Arabia, and she corresponds to the present city of Jerusalem, because Jerusalem and her people are living in slavery.

verses.kjv: But Jerusalem which is above is free, which is the mother of us all.
verses.web: But the Jerusalem that is above is free, which is the mother of us all.
verses.ct: But the Jerusalem above is free, and she is our mother.

verses.kjv: For it is written, Rejoice, thou barren that bearest not; break forth and cry, thou that travailest not: for the desolate hath many more children than she which hath an husband.
verses.web: For it is written, “Rejoice, you barren who don’t bear. Break out and shout, you who don’t travail. For the desolate have more children than her who has a husband.”
verses.ct: As Scripture says: "Celebrate, you woman who never gave birth! Shout for joy, you who never experienced labor pains! Because the abandoned woman will have far more children than the woman who has a husband."

verses.kjv: Now we, brethren, as Isaac was, are the children of promise.
verses.web: Now we, brothers, as Isaac was, are children of promise.
verses.ct: Now you, brothers and sisters, are children of promise — just like Isaac was.

verses.kjv: But as then he that was born after the flesh persecuted him that was born after the Spirit, even so it is now.
verses.web: But as then, he who was born according to the flesh persecuted him who was born according to the Spirit, so also it is now.
verses.ct: But just as the son born by ordinary means persecuted the son born by the Spirit back then, the same thing is happening now.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless what saith the scripture? Cast out the bondwoman and her son: for the son of the bondwoman shall not be heir with the son of the freewoman.
verses.web: However what does the Scripture say? “Throw out the servant and her son, for the son of the servant will not inherit with the son of the free woman.”
verses.ct: But what does Scripture say? "Send the slave woman and her son away, because the slave woman's son will never share the inheritance with the free woman's son."

verses.kjv: So then, brethren, we are not children of the bondwoman, but of the free.
verses.web: So then, brothers, we are not children of a servant, but of the free woman.
verses.ct: So then, brothers and sisters, we are not children of the slave woman. We are children of the free woman.
